Package domain

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
domain.GameController
public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
A class of GameController that holds the ProgramArea and Gameworld Implementation. It contains functions for the execution of the program. This class connects and controls the ProgramArea and the Gameworld.
Version:
4.0
Author:
Andreas Awouters Thomas Van Erum Dirk Vanbeveren Geert Wesemael

    • GameController

      public GameController() throws java.lang.InstantiationException, java.lang.IllegalAccessException

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public ExecutionCommand execute() throws java.lang.Exception
      Execute the next block if the program is in progress. If this execution fails the execution stops and the gameWorld resets. When the program is not in progress, the gameworld resets and the execution starts (if possible). Returns the command of the execution.
      Returns:
      The execution command of the executed command. | return = programArea.exeCmd
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - The execution can't run or the exection can't start.

    • stopExecution

      public void stopExecution()
      Stop the execution of the program.

    • getNextBlockToExecute

      public Block getNextBlockToExecute()
      The next block to execute.
      Returns:
      The next block to execute. |Result = getProgramArea().getNextToExecute()

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect​(Block block)
      Disconnect the current block from the blocks above, to the left of or around this block. Add the block as a TopLevelBlock in the ProgramArea.
      Parameters:
      block - The block to disconnect.

    • connect

      public boolean connect​(Block firstBlock, Block secondBlock)
      Connect the firstBlock to secondBlock. The secondBlock is removed from the ProgramArea. Return true if blocks are connected successfully.
      Parameters:
      firstBlock - The block that gets connected to.
      secondBlock - The block to connect to the firstBlock.
      Returns:
      true if blocks are connected successfully.

    • setBody

      public void setBody​(SurroundingBlock surroundingBlock, SequenceBlock block)
      Set the body of the given surroundingBlock to the given block.
      Parameters:
      surroundingBlock - The SurroundingBlock to add block as body to.
      block - The SequenceBlock to put inside the body of the SurroundingBlock.

    • setBody

      block - The SequenceBlock to put inside the body of the FunctionDefinitionBlock.

    • setNewExecution

      public void setNewExecution​(Block currentlyExecuted, Block nextToExecute)
      Remember the block that is executed right now and te block that is next to be executed.
      Parameters:
      currentlyExecuted - The currently executed block.
      nextToExecute - The block to execute after the currently executed block.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a list of all the FunctionCallBlocks with the same ID as the given ID. | Result = getProgramArea().getAllFunctionCallsWithID(ID)
